summary: The ESA Amendments Act of 2025 aims to revise the Endangered Species Act of 1973. It focuses on optimizing conservation through resource prioritization, incentivizing conservation on private lands, providing incentives for species recovery, increasing transparency and accountability, streamlining permitting processes, and eliminating barriers to conservation. The bill includes provisions for listing petitions, candidate conservation agreements, protective regulations, and disclosure of expenditures. Key changes involve definitions, appropriations, and revisions to existing sections of the ESA.
